page_title: 6 Days Hunza Karimabad Couple Tour Package

sections.content: Hunza Valley is one of the top tourist attraction points in Northern Areas Tour Packages. We offer Hunza Valley 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9-day trips to cover all main tourist places. The most historical place to visit in Hunza is the Baltit & Altit Fort with your local tour guide, founded in the 8th century. You can see the mountain diversity of Nagar Valley (Home of Rakaposhi – The Mother of Mist) right from Hunza Karimabad. Trip to Hunza Valley offers many attractions such as Eagles Nest Hunza, Attabad Lake, and Passu Cones. We offer custom Hunza Tour packages, which include comfortable stays at hotels in Karimabad, Passu, and Attabad Lake. Visit the Khunjerab Pass (Pakistan-China Border) on a day tour. Cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge, enjoy boating at Attabad Lake, and photograph Passu Peaks. Karimabad is the capital of Hunza Valley, surrounded by the Karakoram mountains. Wake up early to a spectacular sunrise over Rakaposhi, explore Altit and Baltit forts, then overnight at Eagle’s Nest.

content: Visit iconic attractions such as Attabad Lake, Karimabad, and local forts
Sightseeing of Rakaposhi & Nanga Parbat and Hoper Nagar Valley
Drive along the Indus River on Karakoram Highway – 8th wonder of the world
Discover Naltar Lakes (Blue and Satrangi Lake) with a Jeep ride
Witness sunset & sunrise at Eagle Nest with views of Golden Peak and Ultar Sar
Local guided tour to ancient Baltit & Altit Fort
Ziplining, paramotoring, and river rafting in Upper Hunza
Spend time at Karimabad Bazaar and taste organic foods
Cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge with zipline
Travel along Karakoram Highway to Khunjerab Pass
Stopover at Nanga Parbat, the 3-mountain junction point
View Passu Peaks, Passu Glacier, and Shispar Glacier

Day_1: Departure for Hunza Naran Valley Tour
Pick up from doorstep by our representative
Check in and rest at hotel in Naran/Chillas
Leisure time or explore local markets
Overnight stay at hotel in Naran/Chillas
Day_2: Breakfast at hotel in early morning
Short stay at Lulusar Lake for photography
5-hour drive to Hunza via Karakoram Highway
Day_3: Visit Attabad Lake and water sports
Sightseeing of Passu & Shispar Peaks with glacier views
Shopping at Sost, the last northern town
Day_4: Visit Altit & Baltit Forts and explore Karimabad Bazaar
Visit medieval Altit Fort (700 years old)
Explore Royal Garden of Altit Valley
Short trek to Baltit Fort (900 years old)
Aerial view of Hunza Valley from the fort
Explore Karimabad Market and local foods
Day_5: Breakfast at hotel in early morning
Check out and move back to Naran at 9:00 am
Short stay at Mother of Mist & Rakaposhi View Point
Day_6: Check out and travel back to Lahore/Islamabad
Short stay at Balakot for rest
Reach Islamabad in evening & Lahore at night
End of services with unforgettable memories

content: Boating & Jet Ski at Attabad Lake
Blazing Sunrise at Eagle Nest Duikar
Local food taste of Glacier Breeze

content.question: How to book the Hunza Pakistan tour?
content.answer: Pay a 40% advance via bank transfer, Easy Paisa, or JazzCash. Foreigners can use Remittance, Western Union, or SWIFT.

content.question: What is special about Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Often called Heaven on Earth, surrounded by peaks like Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, Nanga Parbat, with rich culture and historic forts.

content.question: What are the hotel options in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Options include Hunza Elites, Hunza Bliss Hotel, Offto Resort, Famree Resort, Darbar Hotel, Roomy Dastan, Serena Hotel, and Luxus Hunza.

content.question: What are the famous fruits of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apples, grapes, cherries, and apricots; apricot blossoms bloom in March–April and fruit is harvested in July.

content.question: What are the famous cakes of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apricot Cake at Glacier Breeze and Walnut Cake at Café De Hunza, made with walnuts, honey, and flour.

content.question: What to buy from Hunza Valley?
content.answer: This information is not available in the provided text.

content.question: How to get a tourist visa to visit Hunza?
content.answer: Apply online via NADRA E-Visa or through Western Union/SWIFT; no NOC required for Gilgit-Baltistan.

content.question: What is Hunza water?
content.answer: Hunza water is naturally gray-blackish, rich in silica colloids, and prized for health benefits.

content.question: Is there any airport in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Flights land at Gilgit (1 hr from Islamabad), then it’s a 3–4 hr drive to Hunza.

content.question: Which mobile networks work in Hunza?
content.answer: Telenor, Zong, and SCOM postpaid networks provide coverage.

content.question: When are the spring and autumn seasons in Hunza?
content.answer: Spring: mid-March to mid-April (blossoms); autumn: mid-October to mid-November (fall foliage).

content.question: What are the best restaurants in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Notable spots include Café De Hunza, Rainbow Restaurant, Pizza Pamir, and local eateries.

content.question: How many days are enough to visit Hunza?
content.answer: A 5–8 day trip lets you fully explore Hunza’s main attractions.

content.question: Is Hunza Valley safe for tourists?
content.answer: Hunza is very safe for local and international visitors, thanks to friendly communities and stable conditions.

content.question: What are the terms & conditions?
content.answer: Check-in 12 pm, check-out 10 am; specified meals only; park fees, tips, and insurance excluded; ID required; rates vary on blackout dates; itinerary subject to change.

content: Accommodation in hotel as per the variant selected
Breakfast and dinner as mentioned in the variant
All toll tax, parking, fuel, and driver allowances
Comfortable and sanitized vehicle for sightseeing
Lunch, tea, and mineral water during travel
Laundry, beverages, phone calls, and personal expenses
Extra expenses due to nature or political reasons
Porter for luggage, medication, evacuation, and rescue
